result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory S. Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gregory S. Howard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gregory S. Howard was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Gregory S. Howard was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory S. Howard

defendant.name: Howard, Gregory S.
defendant.address: 316 E. Timber Drive, Apt.B, Rhinelander, WI 54501

records.addlTxt: per Connor @ ONSO - posted - Langlade County
Per Connor- detained in Langlade County - WF of $30.00 added

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant is unemployed at this time and wishes to skip this month's payment and will make up next month
From defendant's mother, Lois, stating defendant is incarcerated and she will mail $50 payment on Friday, February 3, 2017.
call from Greg he will be paying his payment on the 1st not the 15th of every month.
Deft set up payment plan w/ Clerk of Courts as ordered. Review Hearing cancelled.

1:33 p.m. Defendant Gregory S. Howard in court, in custody via video. Defendant states that he doesn't know why he hasn't made any payments - was confused - thought maybe it would get taken off his taxes - happened to him once before. Court explains process. Defendant states he understands. Didn't show up in court because he was confused about it all. Defendant states he will make a payment plan with Clerk of Court if he is released from jail; was supposed to start new job this week and this "popped up".  Court releases defendant with review hearing - Defendant is to make $100 payment plus $10 payment plan fee with Clerk of Court, monthly payments of $100 for payment plan - all to be completed prior to October 21, 2016. Adj. 1:39 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Per Brandi at ONSO - in custody Oneida County
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

Defendant Gregory S. Howard in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:34
State moves to dismiss count 3 and drop the DV enhancers on count 1 and 2 - Granted - Plea questionnaire filed- No  contest plea to count 1 and 2 as amended -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Schiek/Burns/Defendant/COurt statement to sentencing 
 Court WHS and POP For 1 year -each CC
CC/CV/DNAAS/supervision fees-   Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office. (due by 8-8-16) Submit DNA sample -  Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO -
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

2:54 p.m. Defendant Gregory S. Howard in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Schiek statement that offer has been made - Burns statement that defendant would like additional time to consider offer. Bail continued. Adj. 2:55 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 11:15 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:39 p.m. Defendant Gregory S. Howard in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan for Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:40 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:31 p.m. Defendant Gregory S. Howard in court, via video, in custody.  Special Prosecutor Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $1500 sig bond. Adj. 1:33 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
